post_info.post_title: Science VS Religin ??????? Is it a good thing?

In one sense, modern science was born of western Christianity.
 
 Although science pre-dates Christianity, it was the need of the rational faiths to understand the universe, so as to understand God, that bore intellectual fruit.
 
 Catholicsm, beginning with St.Augustine of Hippo, started to come to the belief in a legalistic-rationalistic knowledge of God. Protestants continued in this way.
 
 St.Anselm developed ratioarguments to prove God exists.
 
 Some westerners, such as Newton, believed that God goverened by laws that we could comprehend, through science
 
 Today, many western Christians continue to try to show God, through science - thus we have 'creation science', where-by it is believed that God's handiwork can be ascertained through rational understanding of nature.
 
 This relationship comes full circle with some scientists seeking God.
 
 This way is foreign to Orthodox Chrisitanity, which accepts God through noetic understanding. Western forms of Christianity started the path of intellectual understanding - which is self-defeating as the mind of man can never understand the unknowable God.
